entry.title: Something people are forgetting about the Gentoo / Luke-jr censorship issue
entry.summary: According to Jeff Garzik, a Bitcoin core developer and open source evangelist at BitPay, there are no plans to add a blacklist to Bitcoin Core. This statement is in response to the issue of a possible blacklist being added to the platform. However, Garzik believes that the entire issue is simply a troll and that people have been unnecessarily sucked into it.Bitcoin Core is an open source project that serves as the reference implementation for the Bitcoin network. It allows users to run a full node on their own computer, which can validate transactions and blocks. The platform is constantly evolving, with developers working to improve its functionality and security by adding new features and fixing bugs.The addition of a blacklist to Bitcoin Core would be a significant change to the platform. A blacklist is a list of addresses or transactions that are banned from being processed on the network. While some may argue that it could help prevent fraud or illegal activities, others believe that it goes against the decentralized nature of Bitcoin.Garzik's statement makes it clear that there are no plans to add a blacklist to Bitcoin Core. This should help ease any concerns that users may have had about the future direction of the platform. Overall, it is important to remain vigilant when it comes to issues surrounding Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, as there are often trolls and misinformation campaigns designed to mislead people.
